message: I'm offering you a product for $10000. I want to assure you that I'm willing to sell it to you at this price, but I'm also willing to sell it to someone else if you don't want it. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to negotiate the price. If you buy it, you'll get a product that might not be worth the price, but it's a risk you'll have to take. What do you say?
I'd like to pass on this offer and wait for the next one. I'm not willing to take on the risk without knowing more about the product.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to give you a bit more information. I've had a few other customers who have purchased a similar product to this one, and they've been willing to pay me $8000 for it. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to sell it to you for less than $10000. However, I'm willing to give you a guarantee that if you buy this product and it's not worth the price to you, I'll give you a second product of your choice (either high or low quality) for free. What do you say?
I'll take the risk and buy the product. I'm willing to take a chance on it, and the guarantee of a free product of my choice is a nice added incentive.
